channel.title: Creating a bot
channel.description: Hey im pretty much new to java .. ive read a few tuts and watched sean greasleys Tuts ... but i cant help but wondering ... how do you make a bot scriptable and give it commands that you can use to create scripts which the bot will recognise ? im not asking to be spoon fed or anything but just to be pointed in the right direction of what methods i need to use to eventually make my own bot :) i kinda wanna make a bot along the lines of ares since i like the speed .. but something along the lines of ibot pro would be cool too .. which ever would be easiest since im not exactly a java expert. Thanks alot :) Pez

item.title: Creating a bot
item.dc:creator: @Taios Taios
item.description:
@Taios wrote:

[quote=“Krichevskoy, post:42, topic:123644”][quote author=Taios link=topic=173442.msg1621549#msg1621549 date=1185153799]
Ruler, in case you hadn’t noticed, we live in a world of mass communication. ‘Come’ does not mean ‘i will come to you’ in physical terms or even the sexual innuendo ’ i will come’.

However msn is always a good option.
[/quote]

Screw modern telecommunications! Make them find you. That way you know they’re dedicated. Then they have to call to set up an appointment and reveal the secret password that will cause you to actually listen to their problems. This should change on a weekly basis and be hidden as a series of cryptic hints in your general area for retrieval. On the day of your supplicant’s arrival, you should arrange to be out of the house for no more than 12 hours but no fewer than 6, so that they must wait and once more contemplate the question’s value against that of your time. Once the supplicant has achieved the honor of your presence, he may present one question.

All answers must be given as haiku.

poor java teaching
the befuddled neophyte
many clueless posts

edit: Hm…more like a senryuu. What’s the kigo for ‘a series of tubes’?[/quote]

LOL.

Read full topic

item.title: Creating a bot
item.dc:creator: @Taios Taios
item.description:
@Taios wrote:

[quote=“ruler, post:35, topic:123644”][quote author=frank_ link=topic=173442.msg1604207#msg1604207 date=1184687403]
i am always open to new things, i admit my knowledge of the client is probably nothing when compared to that of semaphone, or even yourself. but if someone were to ask about something that i knew how it worked, i would give them enough information to ask more questions or find the solution themself, granted of course that they were willing to learn. but thats just my attitude, it cannot be helped if people wish to ‘whore’ information.
[/quote]
well frank we dont expect you to know the client better then those who code the client. However frank we expect big things out of you.

i am always open to new things, i admit my knowledge of the client is probably nothing when compared to that of semaphone, or even yourself. but if someone were to ask about something that i knew how it worked, i would give them enough information to ask more questions or find the solution themself, granted of course that they were willing to learn. but thats just my attitude, it cannot be helped if people wish to ‘whore’ information.

Well there is nothing wrong with information and i don’t intend to give that impression :).

If someone was working through the client and then came and asked me about something in it, i would try to answer it :). That same person i am more likely to give hints and tips about other or useful things.

Good answer!, how do we come to you if we dont know where you live.

Ok guys, you can have iBot source, if you come to my laptop.

humor–/=0[/quote]

Ruler, in case you hadn’t noticed, we live in a world of mass communication. ‘Come’ does not mean ‘i will come to you’ in physical terms or even the sexual innuendo ’ i will come’.

However msn is always a good option.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Taios wrote:

[quote=“frank_, post:29, topic:123644”][me=frank_]hasn’t looked at the code (since his partial manual refactor)[/me]

im in the happy naive stage where one can simple make hooks that wont break.

you know more about it then me, do tell what they are doing. or is it valuable information?

i have always agreed with this attitude of ruler’s. though you don’t (and definitely shouldnt!) have to spoon feed people, a subtle gesture in the correct direction will assist amazingly[/quote]

Why give gestures to people whom aren’t looking or trying to? What would be the point in that lol? Like you said, should ‘spoon feed people’ :).

item.title: Creating a bot
item.dc:creator: @Taios Taios
item.description:
@Taios wrote:

[quote=“ruler, post:16, topic:123644”][quote author=Taios link=topic=173442.msg1601979#msg1601979 date=1184625784]

bcel solution is much quicker to implment and jagex is not doing much of anything right now.

There is too many bcel bots coming out. Jagex have to do something and have already started to :).
[/quote]
lol

here comes the FUD.

you know more about it then me, do tell what they are doing. or is it valuable information?[/quote]

I’m not going to reply and tell you simply because its easy enough to open a deob and look at some of the new things. Ollie i think has spotted some aswell. I’ve spent a lot of time over the past few days looking at these and have been up quite late each night.

Also, Semaphore summed up your comment in one easy quote lolololol.

They have changed some important portions of the game. Anyone that says otherwise either 
* Doesn't understand the code
* Hasn't looked at the code
* Is trying to make themselves look smart by patronizing those that have looked at the code</blockquote>

Read full topic

item.title: Creating a bot
item.dc:creator: @BAsh_CntLgn BAsh(CntLgn)
item.description:
@BAsh_CntLgn wrote:

[quote=“frank_, post:26, topic:123644”]they wouldnt have that check in the client anyway, it would just send the value server-side for a check

[code] public static Method[] getMethods(Class<?> c) {
List methods = Arrays.asList(c.getMethods());
Iterator it = methods.iterator();
while (it.hasNext()) {
Method m = it.next();
if (isBadInterface(m.getDeclaringClass())) {
it.remove();
}
}
return methods.toArray(new Method[]{});
}

private static boolean isBadInterface(Class<?> c) {
    return c.getPackage().getName().equals(Constants.HOOK_PACKAGE);
}[/code]

then just replace the calls to getMethods()

note: i havent actually tested the code, so there may be a problem with it, having just written it now[/quote]
That will work…and it is ridiculously easy.
Just remember to check the other get methods such as getDeclaredMethod and so on…
A check by the client will only work for a few updates before someone releases some code that hacks the classes on the fly…then everyone will copy it and that will be that.

Read full topic

item.title: Creating a bot
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

they wouldnt have that check in the client anyway, it would just send the value server-side for a check

[code] public static Method[] getMethods(Class<?> c) {
List methods = Arrays.asList(c.getMethods());
Iterator it = methods.iterator();
while (it.hasNext()) {
Method m = it.next();
if (isBadInterface(m.getDeclaringClass())) {
it.remove();
}
}
return methods.toArray(new Method[]{});
}

private static boolean isBadInterface(Class<?> c) {
    return c.getPackage().getName().equals(Constants.HOOK_PACKAGE);
}[/code]

then just replace the calls to getMethods()

note: i havent actually tested the code, so there may be a problem with it, having just written it now

Read full topic

item.title: Creating a bot
item.dc:creator: @Silver_Lining Silver Lining
item.description:
@Silver_Lining wrote:

I’m not wrong. A way to do it, for instance, would be to have a hashmap of correct method counts, which would require an entire separate method to load the values to. The “much more” part was an exaggeration though.

Read full topic

item.title: Creating a bot
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

[quote=“Silver Lining, post:21, topic:123644”][quote author=qauters link=topic=173442.msg1602820#msg1602820 date=1184641638]

Jagex could very easily destroy all of the BCEL bots with this line of pseudocode: “if(clazz.getMethods().length > correct_method_count) killzlol();” Why they haven’t done that yet, I have no idea.

If they did it client side you would just replace the amount (same idea as UID replacement).
[/quote]Yes, that would work, but it would be much more complex than UID replacement.[/quote]If you honestly think that, stop making your bot right now.

Read full topic

item.title: Creating a bot
item.dc:creator: @Silver_Lining Silver Lining
item.description:
@Silver_Lining wrote:

I suppose they probably want to wait a while for more BCEL bots to come out for maximum effect…

Read full topic

item.title: Creating a bot
item.dc:creator: @Krichevskoy Krichevskoy
item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

[quote=“Silver Lining, post:21, topic:123644”][quote author=qauters link=topic=173442.msg1602820#msg1602820 date=1184641638]

Jagex could very easily destroy all of the BCEL bots with this line of pseudocode: “if(clazz.getMethods().length > correct_method_count) killzlol();” Why they haven’t done that yet, I have no idea.

If they did it client side you would just replace the amount (same idea as UID replacement).
[/quote]Yes, that would work, but it would be much more complex than UID replacement.[/quote]

The tricky thing to do would be to make the check serverside and vary the number of methods in each version. It could still be spoofed, but it would add an extra step to updating.

I assume they don’t do to avoid using more reflection than is absolutely necessary.

Read full topic
